title: Hot property: Cool conversions
text:
Former tram shed, Holloway, London, £2.395m

Where In Warlters Road, just off busy Holloway Road in north London. Convenient for bus and Tube routes to the City of London and the West End.

What Part of a former tram shed (trams had been retired from this London area by the early 1950s). The house has five bedrooms, six bathrooms and a bespoke kitchen. A wide galleried hall, with industrial staircases, links the lower and upper levels.

Why It is a light-filled property, accessed from a quiet side street, with a garage and a large, south-facing roof terrace. The green spaces of Hampstead Heath are reasonably nearby. Shops, bars and restaurants proliferate in Islington's Upper Street about a mile away.

Who The Modern House

Church conversion, Dorsoduro, Venice, €3.5m

Where On the small Campo San Vio square, by the Grand Canal and handy for the city's water taxi service. Venice Marco Polo airport is about 8km from the city.

What A converted chapel dating from the early 19th century. The property (its living room, with original marbles, was once an apse) has three bedrooms and two bathrooms, a well-equipped kitchen and a first-floor balcony.

Why In the Dorsoduro neighbourhood, not far from the Peggy Guggenheim museum and other cultural attractions. The waterfront is popular for a characteristic evening passeggiata.

Who Knight Frank

Converted carriage house, New York, $7.995m

Where On Eldridge Street in Manhattan's Lower East Side, not far from Little Italy, the Bowery and Delancey Street; about 16 miles from John F Kennedy International Airport (a taxi takes about 30 minutes on a good day).

What A converted 19th-century carriage house, once reportedly owned by a successful butcher and sausage-casing entrepreneur. Four bedrooms and bathrooms, a large kitchen, high wood-beamed ceilings, heated floors and two wood-burning fireplaces.

Why The building is three storeys high, with a roof deck. Skylights reflect on to a custom-designed interior “waterfall”. A former loading dock acts as a garage. Features include the building's original painted company sign.

Who Luxury Portfolio International

Former water treatment station, French Riviera, €7.5m

Where Looking down from the hills of Villefranche-sur-Mer on the Côte d'Azur. Nearby airports are Monaco, about 9km away, and Nice, about 10km.

What This family villa has five bedrooms, five bathrooms, a swimming pool, terraces for barbecue and warm-weather dining, and excellent sea views.

Why In a peaceful south-east- facing setting that overlooks Villefranche-sur-Mer harbour and bay. Excellent for access to the rest of the French and Italian Rivieras.

Who Savills

Former industrial building, Riga, Latvia, €3m

Where By the Daugava river in the Latvian capital, a short walk from the city's ancient old town. Riga International Airport is about 11km and 20 minutes' drive away.

What A three-storey conversion of a 19th-century former chalk, gypsum and cement works. It has three bedrooms and bathrooms, a spacious living room with fireplace, and an outdoor terrace. 

Why The villa has a lift, two underground parking places and 24-hour security. It has views of the port and access to rural surrounds.

Who Sotheby's International Realty
